meanings.sent1: The explorers were colonising the new land, building homes and farms.
meanings.sent2: The settlers were colonising the island, creating a new community.
meanings.sent3: The ants were colonising the picnic area, claiming all the crumbs for themselves.
meanings.sent4: The vines were colonising the garden, spreading and intertwining rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The bacteria were colonising the petri dish, multiplying and forming colonies.

meanings.definition: Settling in and establishing control over a new area.
meanings.sent1: The conquerors were colonising the conquered lands, imposing their rule.
meanings.sent2: The company was colonising the market, dominating sales in the region.
meanings.sent3: The kids were colonising the playground, claiming all the swings and slides.
meanings.sent4: The weeds were colonising the garden, taking over the flower beds.
meanings.sent5: The mold was colonising the damp walls, spreading its spores everywhere.
